page.title: 18(CONT.) SHOPPING / CARS
page.content:
{STOURPORT}is the main town for{food {shopping.}Other requirements are bought at Worcester and Kidderminster. Bread, milk and newspapers are still delivered, though there is a national campaign at present urging people to buy milk from their local dairies and not imported milk from supermarkets.
Almost{half}the households own{two {cars}while the other{half}own{one. {Four households}own{three}cars,{two own{one}and{four}households, all retired people, have{no}car. The {majority}are used for purely local journeys as they do under{50 miles per {week,}though a fair proportion do over {200 miles per week.}These belong to commuters, one of whom, a Local Government Officer, travels daily to Lancashire.
